title: 104_hr2272
content: The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1995" is cited as the short title. It excludes certain pensions and annuities under public retirement systems according to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1995" excludes qualified governmental pensions from gross income, subject to limitations on the amount excluded and a service requirement. The "Public Pension Parity Act of 1995" excludes qualified governmental pensions from gross income, subject to limitations on the amount excluded and a service requirement. The term 'qualified governmental pension' refers to pensions received under a public retirement system not attributable to certain types of employment. The term 'maximum excludable social security benefits' defines the amount of social security benefits that can be excluded from taxable income. The term 'applicable maximum benefit amount' defines the maximum individual social security benefit that can be excluded from gross income based on marital status. The term 'maximum individual social security benefit' refers to the highest total amount that can be paid as old-age insurance benefits to an individual who has reached retirement age and applied for benefits. The term 'public retirement system' refers to any pension, annuity, retirement, or similar fund established by the United States or its subdivisions. It also includes regulations for reducing social security benefits for individuals receiving partial-year pensions. Technical amendments are made to the tax code, including inserting "137," before "911" in the definition of modified adjusted gross income. A clerical amendment redesignates section 137 as section 138 and adds a new item after section 136 in the table of excluded income items. The amendments made by this Act regarding certain pensions and annuities under public retirement systems will apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment date of the Act.
